1.comment: Jordan Poyer fielded a punt in the 4.h quarter. He muffed it, and the Jaguars scored via a Robinson run following the recovery.   Poyer fielded a punt in the 4.h quarter. He muffed it, and the Jaguars scored via a Robinson run following the recovery.

2.comment: Jordan Poyer made an incredible play to wrestle the ball away from Robby Anderson, who looked like he made an incredible catch.Poyer made an incredible play to wrestle the ball away from Robby Anderson, who looked like he made an incredible catch. The Jets then waved the white flag on the next possession, punting on 4.h-and-short despite being down 2 possessions with about 4 minutes remaining. It was 1 of several curious decisions Todd Bowles made this afternoon.    Tyrod Taylor finished 16-of-28 for 224 yards, 2 touchdowns and an interception, which, as discussed, wasn't his fault. Taylor also did some work on the ground, dashing for 38 yards on 8 scrambles. Taylor was awful in the preseason, but he had a nice performance in his 2017 debut. Before anyone gets too excited, however, Taylor threw against the worst team I've ever covered, so I wouldn't expect him to maintain this level of production.    LeSean McCoy had a scare in this game when he hurt his hand on a run down to the 1-yard line. He left the game, allowing Mike Tolbert to vulture a touchdown. McCoy returned on the next drive, so everything is OK. McCoy looked great, gaining 110 yards on 22 carries and also catching 5 balls for 49 receiving yards. McCoy was as outstanding as those numbers indicate, and he even juked Jamal Adams out of his cleats in the early going on a 21-yard catch-and-run play.    Despite his blunders, Clay had a nice stat line, registering 4 catches for 53 yards and a touchdown. He trailed only Jordan Matthews (2-61), who did most of his work on 1 47-yard reception. The big catch (47 yards) was a nice play by Taylor, as he escaped some pressure and kept his eyes downfield. Meanwhile, Zay Jones converted only 1 of his 4 targets for 21 yards. He was a big disappointment.    Moving on to the Jets, Josh McCown finished with a nice completion percentage (26-of-39), but only because he dinked and dunked on almost every throw. He didn't have much of a choice because of poor protection, but I'd still describe him as Sam Bradford on crack. His 39 attempts went for 187 yards, which gave him a YPA of 4.79. To put that in perspective, McCoy averaged more yards per carry than McCown did per throw! McCown tossed 2 interceptions, but neither was really his fault. The first, which I discussed already, was a great play by Poyer. The second was a desperation heave in the final minutes.    I mentioned some questionable decisions made by Bowles. I'd say not involving

3.comment: Jordan Poyer hit him hard and dislodged the ball. Poyer hit him hard and dislodged the ball.
